@Cville_Spurs As a fellow Jew I'm with you. 
What I find very odd is how they won't say the word yid and instead say "y word".  Yid, like the word Jew, can be used as a slur by the goyim but it's not inherently offensive and makes it seem like they don't view Yiddish as a real language.

rawContent:
When I was playing an under 17’s match early in my career, I was stepping up to bend a free kick in the top bin (as you do). The opposition’s five man wall called me black bastard, ni**er, coon etc. The ref took no notice when I told him.

That has scarred me FOREVER!

2/2

@hellospencerguy @StefAmini @AlasdairGold In point of fact, "Yid" is simply the Yiddish word for "Jew". Jews have been calling themselves Yids for centuries.
"Yid Army!" chanted by a group of friendly Spurs fans is not offensive.
"F-ing Yid!" yelled by a skinhead with a swastika tattoo is offensive.
Context is everything
